If the Federal Communications Commission must be involved in
a decision on this question, valuable time will be lost. It
is agreed that the legal issue can be circumvented. The time
delay is the factor at issue.
The question of the willingness of licensees in key markets to
commit their stations to all-network programming should be
resolved.
Before the model is developed, firm commitments should be obÂ¬
tained from key stations in a minimum of ten markets. To
test the model the fewer key affiliates would result in a
limited national reaction.
Initiating a public radio service on a nine hour per day level
minimum (as proposed) would create an economic and cultural
shock that would prove detrimental to long range goals.
Moving quickly from zero hours to nine or more per day would
result in these inherent difficulties:
A. Funding. What sources, if any, are available
to support the model? Network costs should relate
to potential sources of support.
